individuals_have_digital_skills_type: Percent of individuals who have at least basic digital skills
jobs_use_computer_type: Number of job advertisments which mention "use a computer"
individuals_self_improve_type: Percent of individuals who carried out free online training or self-study to improve their digital skills
plan_digital_skills: Yes; France is part of the EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027.; France is also a member of the Digital Skills and Job Coalition wich has collectivly developed a plan to address the digital skills gap.
plan_links: EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; https://ec.europa.eu/education/education-in-the-eu/digital-education-action-plan_en; Digital Skills and Job Coalition; https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/digital-skills-jobs-coalition;Additional Information; https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=auto&tl=en&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.french-digital-coalition.fr;Potential Manifesto to include in each EU country;https://all-digital.org/focus-areas/
broadband_plan: yes; The national broadband programme, France Très Haut Débit, sets out the targets of fast broadband access for all households by 2022 and fibre for all by 2025.
programs_digital_skills: yes; In an effort to boost digital literacy, the French government has launched its “digital pass” programme to enable 200,000 people to participate in up to ten digital skills training sessions at little or no cost.

plan_digital_skills: Yes; Germany is part of the EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; Germany is als a member of the Digital Skills and Job Coalition wich has collectivly developed a plan to address the digital skills gap.
plan_links: EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; https://ec.europa.eu/education/education-in-the-eu/digital-education-action-plan_en; Digital Skills and Job Coalition; https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/digital-skills-jobs-coalition
broadband_plan: Yes; The 2018 coalition agreement of the German Federal Government identifies the priority goal of a nationwide expansion of gigabit networks by 2025. The federal government has also developed a 5G Strategy for Germany.;  Also, The federal government’s DigitalPakt Schule (Digital Compact for Schools) is ensuring that fast internet connections are installed at some 43,000 schools in Germany along with an effective digital learning infrastructure.
programs_digital_skills: yes; The German government is securing traineeships that are jeopardised by the pandemic. A sum of 500 million euros has been earmarked for the federal programme "Ausbildungsplätze sichern". This year and next year it will support small and medium enterprises with a workforce of up to 249, in order to mitigate the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic on the market for traineeships. The federal programme is also to ensure that skilled workers are available in the coming years.; Investment in education rises substantially. More people with university degrees, higher education spending and greater permeability in the education system – those are the key takeaways from the "Education in Germany 2020" report, which the Cabinet addressed on Wednesday. The spotlight is on digital education, which has become more important than ever before as a result of the pandemic.

plan_digital_skills: Yes; Italy is part of the EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; Italy  is also a member of the Digital Skills and Job Coaltion wich has collectivly developed a plan to address the digital skills gap.; Republic is the national strategic initiative promoted by the Department for the digital transformation of the Presidency of the Council of the Ministries to contrast the form of the digital division of cultural characteristics.
plan_links: EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; https://ec.europa.eu/education/education-in-the-eu/digital-education-action-plan_en; Digital Skills and Job Coalition; https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/digital-skills-jobs-coalition
broadband_plan: yes; Main aims for broadband development bring connectivity with a minimum of 100 Mbps for up to 85% of the Italian population, guarantee coverage of at least 30 Mbps to all citizens, coverage of at least 100 Mbps for offices and public buildings, bring high speed broadband in the industrial areas.
programs_digital_skills: yes; On 8 April 2020, the Ministry for Technological Innovation and Digitalization launched the Italian National Coalition for Digital Skills and Jobs. The coalition builds on ‘Repubblica Digitale’, a multi-stakeholder initiative that promotes digital skills at all levels of the Italian economy and society

plan_digital_skills: Yes;Spain is part of the EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; Spain is also a member of the Digital Skills and Job Coaltion wich has collectivly developed a plan to address the digital skills gap.
plan_links: EU's Digital Education Action Plan 2021-2027; https://ec.europa.eu/education/education-in-the-eu/digital-education-action-plan_en; Digital Skills and Job Coalition; https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/digital-skills-jobs-coalition
broadband_plan: yes; The Spanish government has announced further details of the plan to bring broadband at speeds of at least 100Mbps and 5G to the entire Spanish population.  The Plan for Connectivity and Digital Infrastructures and the Strategy to Promote 5G Technology, part of the government’s Spain Digital 2025 Agenda, will receive EUR 4.3 billion of public funding for expanding fiber-optic infrastructure to underserved areas and extending 5G coverage.
broadband_links: The Plan for Connectivity and Digital Infrastructures and the Strategy to Promote 5G Technology; https://techblog.comsoc.org/2020/12/02/spains-plan-to-bring-ftth-and-5g-to-its-entire-population/
programs_digital_skills: yes; In July, Spain released their Digital Agenda 2025 to mobilze 70,000 million Euros On Goal is to "Strengthen the digital skills of workers and of citizens as a whole. Special emphasis will be placed on the needs of the labor market and on closing the digital divide in education. The goal is that in 2025 80% of people have basic digital skills and that half of them are women." ; The State Public Employment Service of Spain (SEPE), the State Foundation for Training in Employment (Fundae) and several large technology companies signed agreements in autumn 2019 to create an important package of training resources in digital skills, publicly available completely free of charge. The companies included Amazon, Cisco, Cloudera, everis, Accenture Foundation, Telefónica Foundation, Google, Huawei, IBM, LPI-Linux Professional Institute, Oracle, and SAP.
programs_links: Digital Agenda 2025;https://thespainjournal.com/sanchez-presents-the-digital-spain-2025-agenda-which-will-mobilize-a-public-and-private-investment-of-70000-million-euros-in-the-period-2020-2022/; Partnerships; https://www.cedefop.europa.eu/en/news-and-press/news/spain-promotion-training-digital-skills-workers; All Digtal Week Highlights; https://alldigitalweek.eu/spain/
